hotels.name: Aki Family Resort
hotels.longDesc: Nestled in the Dolomites, this family-focused resort offers easy access to hiking, skiing, and charming alpine villages. The mountain views and Italian hospitality make it an ideal base for outdoor-loving families.

hotels.name: Falkensteiner Family Resort Lido
hotels.longDesc: A lakeside family resort combining water activities with mountain access, perfect for kids who want both lake swimming and mountain exploration. Excellent for families seeking comfort with adventure.

hotels.name: Quercia Rubra Villa
hotels.longDesc: A luxury countryside villa in Tuscany offering the full agritourism experience: rolling vineyards, cooking classes, and spacious rooms for families. Combines relaxation with authentic Tuscan village life.

hotels.name: Il San Pietro di Positano
hotels.longDesc: Dramatically perched above the Amalfi Coast, this clifftop resort offers terraced gardens, private beach access, and breathtaking Mediterranean views. A magical destination for families seeking luxury by the sea.

hotels.name: Borgo Santo Pietro
hotels.longDesc: A restored medieval village-hotel in Tuscany blending historic charm with modern luxury, featuring pool, spa, and farm-to-table dining. Perfect for families wanting immersive cultural experiences with comfort.

hotels.name: Aman Venice
hotels.longDesc: Venice's most exclusive resort, offering private gardens, spa, and authentic gondola access in the Grand Canal area. A once-in-a-lifetime base for exploring the Floating City.

restaurants.desc: Rome, Lazio â€” Note: A household name, eating at the deli-restaurant Roscioli is an absolute must while in town. This culinary haven lies just steps from Campo de Fiori and serves Roman classics alongside a mouthwatering array of fresh cheeses, cold cuts and pickled products straight from the deli counter. Itâ€™s a classic haunt beloved by food critics and travellers alike, so make sure to book a table in advance.

restaurants.name: Ma Che Siete Venuti A FÃ
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Hamburgeseria Burger Bar
restaurants.desc: Indulge in American burgers with a made-in-Italy flair at this eclectic pub in San Lorenzo. With its mismatched chairs and tables and wine-stocked shelves, Hamburgeseria looks halfway between a cosy restaurant and a hipster co-working space. Every burger on the menu is filled with five local ingredients â€“ the Danish meat (or fish in some cases) always meets its par with a contrasting vegetable, cheese and sauce â€“ all made in-house. They also have great fried starters, wraps and salads, but hamburgers are king.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Il Mulino ai quattro venti
restaurants.desc: This cosy family-run restaurant on a steep street on the hill of Monteverde caters to your every fancy: whether youâ€™re craving meat, fish, vegetables, dessert or all of the above, the menu here will not disappoint. Youâ€™ll find plenty of revisited recipes for traditional dishes, made with quality local produce and paired with innovative garnish. The menu at Mulino Ai Quattro Venti (The Mill on the Four Winds) changes every few months and the managers are known for their cordiality and kindness, so itâ€™s a place to visit often. Their duck breast is a must-have.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: MARE NOSTRUM Seafood
restaurants.desc: Mare Nostrum (Latin for â€˜our seaâ€™) is Roman by circumstance, Sicilian by origin, and Mediterranean by choice. This restaurant in Trastevere takes inspiration from seafood across the Med â€“and in a landlocked city that has plenty of good seafood restaurants, Mare Nostrum is in a league of its own. An example of the unusual but tasteful juxtapositions is their popular Paccheri Creuza de MÃ : pasta with salmon tartare, greenified by a light touch of basil pesto, finished off with Parmesan fondue, a orange and pistachio crumbs.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Il Margutta
restaurants.desc: Since 1979, this chic restaurant has been delighting diners with its imaginative vegetarian cuisine, offering a fresh twist on Mediterranean flavors. A self-titled â€˜ristoarteâ€™, Il Margutta showcases dishes as vibrant as the contemporary works of art that adorn its walls. From vegetables and grains to salads and pastas, everything is colorful, nutritious and full of flavor.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Ai Tre Scalini
restaurants.desc: A fixture in Monti, Ai Tre Scalini is a bustling wine bar cherished by locals, where patrons of all ages gather day and night to enjoy glasses of wine paired with cheeses and cold cuts. Its vibrant atmosphere spills onto the streets, where guests mingle beneath cascading ivy. Originally a historic canteen dating back to 1895, Ai Tre Scalini transformed into a wine bar bistro in the 1990s, delighting visitors with a diverse menu featuring Roman classics like oven-baked lasagna and meatballs, alongside an impressive array of wines available by the glass.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Supplizio
restaurants.desc: The humble supplÃ¬ is Romeâ€™s most quintessential street food snack. The deep-fried rice ball has its roots in the cityâ€™s Cucina povera (â€˜poor manâ€™s cuisineâ€™) tradition, which makes the most of simple ingredients. Today, youâ€™ll find modern variants at chef Arcangelo Dandiniâ€™s beloved eatery. Try the supplÃ¬ with butter and anchovies or the arrabbiata for a kick.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Pastificio San Lorenzo
restaurants.desc: Tucked away in the lively student district of San Lorenzo, Pastificio San Lorenzo blends old-school charm with a modern twist. Set inside a former pasta factory, it pays homage to the neighborhoodâ€™s industrial roots while serving up seriously good food in a sleek, stylish space. The menu is all about elevated Italian comfort food, from handmade pastas and creative meats and fish, plus an excellent drinks list. This spot also doubles as a cultural hub, hosting live music, art exhibits and special events, making it a great place to soak up some local flavour away from the tourist hotspots.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Ristorante Va.Do.
restaurants.desc: Located in Romeâ€™s most hipster neighborhood, Va.Do al Pigneto is a restaurant boasting a modern, industrial design and an eclectic menu that will suit all kinds of appetites. Fish lovers, meat-eaters and vegetarians will all feel at home even while browsing through some international dishes like chicken curry, ravioli with pork cheek and spaghetti with tuna tartare. If youâ€™re craving Roman classics, worry not: you can find those here alongside desserts the likes of tiramisu, almond-flour chocolate cake and frozen treats.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Giulia Restaurant
restaurants.desc: Located on one of Romeâ€™s most elegant streets, Giulia is a romantic restaurant that brings flavour and flair to the heart of the Eternal City. Chef Pierluigi Gallo, who came from the Campania region and honed his skills in Abruzzo, reimagines classic comfort food that will delight diners. Oxtail is served with celery and cocoa ketchup, while spaghetti is coated in a red sauce made with baby octopus, sea snails and sea urchins.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: BARRED
restaurants.desc: Avant-garde Italian cuisine is the key to Barred, a restaurant between the areas of San Giovanni and Re di Roma. Founded by two brothers, Barred is a celebration of natureâ€™s gifts, as seasonable foods are proposed in daring combinations. The widely varied menu changes several times a year, so you know youâ€™re getting fresher than fresh food here. If you canâ€™t pick between the many unusual offerings, they also have a tasting menu of four dishes chosen by the kitchen. The drink list includes over 20 pages of wines from all over Europe, as well as ciders and beers.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Bar Meccanismo
restaurants.desc: In the heart of Rome, Meccanismo Bar & Bistrot is the perfect spot for lunch and aperitivo in Trastevereâ€™s Piazza Trilussa. Its  extensive Ã  la carte menu has international options for all (burgers, salads, cous cous, meat, fish, and more), but make sure to check out whatâ€™s cooking on the daily menu. Handwritten on a slip of paper, the menu will be given to you by your server, and features three to five pasta and main dish options based on daily availability of produce. If youâ€™re lucky, a gricia ubriaca will be available: a twist on the classic Roman dish, with wine turning your plate of pasta, guanciale and pecorino a dark red.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Trapizzino | Trastevere
restaurants.desc: Stefano Callegari, the mastermind behind Trapizzino, invented this innovative street food: the lovechild of pizza and tramezzino, taking the thick dough from its mother and the triangular shape from its father. The result is a soft and mouthwateringly flavourful pouch filled with deliciousness ranging from pork tongue in green sauce and eggplant parmesan to meatballs with tomato sauce and chicken cacciatore, plus vegetarian options like Roman artichoke and misticanza â€“ a mixture of leafy greens sautÃ©ed in garlic and red chilli pepper.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Osteria Fernanda
restaurants.desc: Osteria Fernanda is on par with many of the cityâ€™s most celebrated establishments. The menu is exceedingly avant-garde, and the dishes are at once â€˜comfort foodâ€™ while providing an innovative culinary experience; previous specials have included rigatoni with a sweet root veg-based sauce and snails and eel with radishes and Campari. The extensive wine list features notable champagnes that will help you wash down the just-as-delicious desserts. The restaurant recently moved location to another space near the Porta Portese market, along with a total revamp of the interior design, so there's no better time to visit.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Ercoli 1928
restaurants.desc: A Roman institution since â€“ yes, you guessed it â€“ 1928, Ercoli is one of the cityâ€™s legendary salumeria (delicatessen) offering a gourmet selection of cheeses, cold cuts and freshly prepared Italian delicacies. Originally opened in Prati, it now has locations in Parioli and Trastevere â€“ the latter is set within a beautifully restored historic cinema and is a fantastic all-day dining spot whenever hunger strikes in between sightseeing. Open from 8am â€™till late, this spot serves up Italian classics; hearty bowls of pasta, cicchetti, charcuterie and more. It can be a bit touristy and overly posh (a section of the menu is dedicated to caviar and blinis), but if you want to get stuck in to good Italian food in a historic setting, this is the spot.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Enoteca La Torre
restaurants.desc: Set within Anna Venturini Fendiâ€™s magnificent Villa Laetitia, Enoteca La Torre captures the essence of la dolce vita. This high-end restaurant serves artful plates that complement its grand setting: helmed by Domenico Stile, who hails from Campania, youâ€™ll find Southern Italian ingredients like buffalo milk cheeses, Sorrento lemons and fresh fish featured on the menu. For a real treat, opt for the seven-course surprise tasting menu selected by the chef. Just be warned, if you hadnâ€™t guessed already, Enoteca La Torre is for special occasions. Its double-Michelin-starred menu comes with a (hefty) price â€“ tasting menus range from â‚¬180 - â‚¬220. But when in Rome, eh?
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: SantoPalato
restaurants.desc: A new wave of traditional Jewish-Roman cuisine reigns at Santo Palato (literally: sacred palate), where abundance is a must. Meat features prominently on the menu of this modern trattoria, and offal is a must-try. The restaurant promises a holistic approach to cooking that refuses waste and is set on lifting and updating authentic central Italian recipes. And if you fancy a vino (why wouldnâ€™t you?), the cantina sports over 800 wines. Make sure to reserve a table in advance for this place.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Felice a Testaccio | ROMA
restaurants.desc: Testaccio is widely considered the best neighbourhood for Roman cuisine, and this eatery is its unrivalled star. With retro checkered floors, white tablecloths, and a tantalizing array of traditional dishes, the old-school restaurant makes a perfect leisurely weekend lunch with family or a romantic choice for a gourmet dinner. Cacio e pepe is Felice a Testaccioâ€™s signature dish; this tangle of spaghetti, melted cheese and black pepper comes freshly tossed at the table for you.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Moma
restaurants.desc: A Michelin star establishment, Moma offers a stellar dining experience with special-occasion prices to match. Named after the Metropolitan Museum of Art, itâ€™s located right in front of the US Embassy and attracts a business crowd that enjoys expertly executed dishes. Youâ€™ll find thoughtful re-interpretations of classic dishes alongside modern plates, like ravioli filled with cod and caramelized onions and chestnut flour lasagne with vegetables and cheese, all appropriately plated like works of art.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: RomanÃ¨
restaurants.desc: Founded by Stefano Callegari (the mastermind behind Trapizzino, #14) RomanÃ¨ is a modern trattoria that puts a fresh spin on classic Roman cuisine. The original location on Via Cipro serves traditional fare with a contemporary touch, while its newer counterpart across the street expands the menu with an array of seafood dishes. Both locations are decorated with Italyâ€™s charming hand painted â€˜piatti del buon ricordoâ€™: collectible plates from the 1970s that commemorate the countryâ€™s most beloved restaurants.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Trattoria Pennestri
restaurants.desc: With its cosy interiors and warm service, Trattoria Pennestri is the kind of restaurant that invites you to linger and enjoy a leisurely meal with good company. Like the ambience, the menu is rustic but refined, with a curated selection of inventive dishes that make the most of the seasonâ€™s ingredients. The wine list is also wonderful, with an ample selection by the glass. Save room for one of the cityâ€™s best desserts: a sweet and salty chocolate mousse served with Sardinian flatbread and infused with rosemary.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Trattoria Da Enzo al 29
restaurants.desc: A picturesque little eatery located on a quieter street in Trastevere, Da Enzo is one of the more characteristic trattorias in Rome and draws a crowd for its simple, honest fare and handful of outdoor tables. Eating here feels like a family gathering, with abundant portions expertly prepared. You canâ€™t go wrong with anything on the menu â€“ from carbonara and meatballs to braised artichokes and tiramisu â€“ but show up early, or youâ€™re in for a long wait.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

restaurants.name: Trattoria Da Cesare al Casaletto
restaurants.desc: Located at the end of the 8 tram that snakes its way through the Trastevere neighbourhood, Cesare al Casalettoâ€™s location outside the city centre hasnâ€™t dampened its popularity among tourists and locals alike. This casual trattoria is the go-to for Romeâ€™s many food writers, bloggers and passionate eaters, thanks to its familial atmosphere and delicious dishes. Order the fried gnocchi served on a melted cacio e pepe sauce, and donâ€™t shy away from the (donâ€™t be afraid) minty Roman tripe and oxtail â€“ itâ€™s near-perfect.
restaurants.longDesc: A wonderful restaurant experience in Italy offering authentic local culture and memorable moments for families.

kidFriendly.name: Aki Family Resort
kidFriendly.longDesc: Nestled in the Dolomites, this family-focused resort offers easy access to hiking, skiing, and charming alpine villages. The mountain views and Italian hospitality make it an ideal base for outdoor-loving families.

kidFriendly.name: Falkensteiner Family Resort Lido
kidFriendly.longDesc: A lakeside family resort combining water activities with mountain access, perfect for kids who want both lake swimming and mountain exploration. Excellent for families seeking comfort with adventure.
